title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 255.171 - Compressor stations: additional safety equipment
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 255.171 - Compressor stations: additional safety equipment

State Regulations
(a) Each compressor station must have
adequate fire protection facilities. If fire pumps are a part of these
facilities, their operation may not be affected by the emergency shutdown
system. (b) Each compressor station
prime mover, other than an electrical induction or synchronous motor, must have
an automatic device to shut down the unit before the speed of either the prime
mover or the driven unit exceeds a maximum safe speed. (c) Each compressor unit in a compressor
station must have a shutdown or alarm device that operates in the event of
inadequate cooling or lubrication of the unit. (d) Each compressor station gas engine that
operates with pressure gas injection must be equipped so that stoppage of the
engine automatically shuts off the fuel and vents the engine distribution
manifold. (e) Each muffler for a
gas engine in a compressor station must have vent slots or holes in the baffles
of each compartment to prevent gas from being trapped in the muffler. (f) All fuel gas lines within a compressor
station, serving the various buildings and residential areas, shall be provided
with master shut-off valves located outside of any building or residential
area. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16
ยง
255.171

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
